question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: Look at the first model. It shows 3 out of 5 equal parts colored, which represents $\frac{3}{5}$.
Look at the second model. It shows 1 out of 5 equal parts colored, which represents $\frac{1}{5}$.
Both models have the same size and are divided into 5 equal parts. This means each part in both models is the same size.
Since the parts are the same size, 1 part is less than 3 parts. Therefore, $\frac{1}{5}$ is less than $\frac{3}{5}$.
solution_image_tag: A vertical rectangle divided into five equal horizontal sections. The fraction 3/5 is displayed below. The top three-thirds are shaded in peach/orange color while the bottom two sections remain white.
A vertical rectangle divided into five equal horizontal sections with the fraction 1/5 below. The top fifth is shaded in light blue while the bottom fourth remains white.
backend_description: Two rectangles side by side showing fraction comparisons. The left rectangle is labeled '3/5' and is divided into five equal horizontal sections, with the top 3 sections colored orange. The right rectangle is labeled '1/5' and is also divided into five sections, with the top section colored light blue.

Second model shows 4 of 5 parts colored: $\frac{4}{5}$.
Both models have 5 equal parts of the same size.
Since 2 < 4, $\frac{2}{5}$ is less than $\frac{4}{5}$.
solution_image_tag: Rectangle divided into 5 sections. 2 sections shaded in orange showing 2/5.
Rectangle divided into 5 sections. 4 sections shaded in blue showing 4/5.
backend_description: Two rectangles comparing fractions. Left: '2/5' with 2 of 5 sections orange. Right: '4/5' with 4 of 5 sections blue.

Second model shows 2 of 7 parts colored: $\frac{2}{7}$.

Since 1 < 2, $\frac{1}{7}$ is less than $\frac{2}{7}$.
